text:
In a response-header of the Tomcat server, the "Content-Type" appears twice:

SOAP SEND: POST <removed> HTTP/1.1
Host: <removed>:43442
User-Agent: gSOAP/2.7
Content-Type: text/xml; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 2195
Connection: keep-alive
SOAPAction: ""
 
 
…. SOAP-Request
 
 
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: text/xml; charset=UTF-8
Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2008 15:13:00 GMT
Content-Type: UTF-8
Server: Apache Tomcat/4.1.34 (HTTP/1.1 Connector)
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
 
… SOAP-Response

No header-related configurations have been made in either server.xml, or web.xml.
creator: klaus.kroener@atosorigin.com
markt@apache.org
text: I can't reproduce this with 4.1.39. I don't recall this being an issue with older Tomcat 4 versions. It looks very much like the application is adding the extra header in error.
